subject: Fashion
title: The Rainbow as Fashion Symbol
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Rainbow as Fashion Symbol usable.

hook.text: Gilbert Baker sewed the first rainbow flag in 1978 using fabric dyes in a San Francisco attic.

buildup.text: The original had eight stripes. Hot pink was dropped because the fabric was hard to mass-produce.

discovery.text: After Harvey Milk's assassination, demand for the flag surged. It became a global symbol of pride.

twist.text: Fashion brands now plaster rainbows on products every June. Critics call it 'rainbow capitalism.'

climax.text: A hand-dyed protest flag became a billion-dollar branding tool. Baker never trademarked it.

punchline.text: He gave the rainbow away. Corporations sold it back.

quiz.question: Why was the hot pink stripe removed from the original rainbow flag?
options: The fabric dye was too hard to mass-produce at scale
It clashed with the other colors in the design
Hot pink was considered too feminine by the activist community
